importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the Blue Jays defeated the Mariners in Game 6, forcing a Game 7 in the ALCS, marking a pivotal moment in the 2025 postseason.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe following the Game 7 decision, including the first World Series game scheduled for Friday, 10/24/2025, sets the stage for the next stage of the MLB postseason.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the postseason, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0 and pushing the series to a Game 7.
The Seattle Mariners committed three errors, including two consecutive fielding mistakes in the second inning, which allowed early runs and contributed to the Blue Jays' 6-2 victory.
Toronto’s victory forces a decisive Game 7, which will be the second in Blue Jays history and their first since 1985.
The winner of the ALCS will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
Mariners’ pitcher Yesevage showed composure by throwing a season-high 31 splitters, allowing only six hits and three walks, and recording seven strikeouts.
The game was pivotal for both teams, marking Seattle's first Game 7 in franchise history and a turning point in the 2025 ALCS.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit his sixth home run of the postseason, a key factor in the Blue Jays’ 6-2 victory over the Mariners and in forcing a Game 7 in the ALCS.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays won Game 6 against the Mariners, forcing a Game 7 and marking their first such game since 1985, highlighting their dominance in the 2025 ALCS.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners lost 6-2 to the Blue Jays, committing critical fielding errors and failing to score after the first inning, leading to a Game 7 matchup in the ALCS.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series (ALCS)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Postseason series in Major League Baseball
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The series is the final stage of the AL playoffs, with the winner advancing to the World Series, and Game 7 being the decisive match.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The National League champion, the Dodgers will face the ALCS winner in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday, 10/24/2025.

namedEntities.name: Yesevage
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He pitched effectively in Game 6, throwing 31 splitters, allowing only six hits and three walks, and recording seven strikeouts, showcasing composure under pressure.

namedEntities.name: Julio Rodríguez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He committed a fielding error on a ground ball, allowing a runner to advance to second base, contributing to early scoring and a critical error in the game.

namedEntities.name: Eugenio Suárez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He lost a ball during a transfer throw in the second inning, leading to a fielding error and subsequent runs for Toronto.

namedEntities.name: Daulton Varsho
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He reached second base due to a fielding error by Julio Rodríguez, setting the stage for the Mariners’ early scoring.

namedEntities.name: Ernie Clement
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a ground ball that resulted in a fielding error by Eugenio Suárez, leading to a run and a critical mistake in the second inning.

namedEntities.name: Addison Barger
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored a run in the second inning with an RBI single and later hit a two-run homer in the third, contributing to Toronto’s early lead.

namedEntities.name: Isiah Kiner-Falefa
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored an RBI single in the second inning with Barger, helping open a 2-0 lead for the Blue Jays.

namedEntities.name: Josh Naylor
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a home run in the sixth inning to score a run, the only run the Mariners scored in the game.

namedEntities.name: Randy Arozerana
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored on a single to the right-field line, with Suárez’s hit putting him on base and scoring him in the sixth inning.

namedEntities.name: Trey Yesavage
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He threw a season-high 31 splitters, allowing only six hits and three walks, and recording seven strikeouts in Game 6, showing exceptional composure.

namedEntities.name: Matt Brash
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He gave up a wild pitch in the seventh inning that allowed Vladimir Guerrero Jr. to score, extending the Blue Jays’ lead to 6-2 and forcing Game 7.

namedEntities.name: Louis Varland
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He faced Eugenio Suárez in the sixth inning, who hit a single that scored Randy Arozerana and brought the Mariners within range of scoring.

namedEntities.name: John Schneider
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He expressed joy and emphasis on enjoying the moment, highlighting the significance of the Blue Jays’ win and their journey to a Game 7.

namedEntities.name: Dan Wilson
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He criticized the team’s fielding errors, attributing a portion of the loss to poor ball handling and miscommunication in the second inning.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the 2025 postseason, helping the Toronto Blue Jays defeat the Seattle Mariners 6-2 to force a decisive Game 7 in the American League Championship Series. The Mariners committed three key fielding errors—two in the second inning—leading to early runs and a significant deficit. Despite a run from Josh Naylor in the sixth, the Blue Jays maintained control, with a wild pitch from Matt Brash in the seventh allowing Guerrero to score and seal the win. The Blue Jays' victory marks their first Game 7 since 1985 and is the second in franchise history. The winner of the series will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday, October 24, 2025.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
